text: When they introduced him to me I said, "But what did you do with your facial angle? The mouth, nose, eyes, ears, out of place, appeared piled up in his face. "Lord", said the man with the upright mouth. Once a ghost-digiter turned my angle. I've known since then that like umbrellas, faces have a frame. And that the frame of the faces is the angle of the face. FIN Poetic Anthology, 2006
title: El ángulo facial
author: Luis Vidales
